1{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Confluent operators for nested relations.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Nest.Confl
7  ( -- * copy
8    consCopy,
9    -- * for
10    consFor, relmapFor, relkitFor,
11    -- * group
12    consGroup, relmapGroup, relkitGroup,
13    -- * slice
14    consSlice, relmapSlice, relkitSlice,
15    -- * slice-up
16    consSliceUp, relmapSliceUp, relkitSliceUp,
17  ) where
18
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.DataPlus          as K
20import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core              as C
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base          as Rop
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat          as Rop
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Nest.Flow     as Rop
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Message  as Msg
25
26
27-- ----------------------  copy
28
29-- | __copy N R__
30--
31--   Copy input relation and referenced by ^N in R.
32--
33--   For example, @down@ @\/r@ can be rewrite to
34--   @copy r ( dee | slice \/r ^r )@.
35--
36consCopy :: C.RopCons c
37consCopy med =
38  do n    <- Rop.getWord   med "-var"
39     rmap <- Rop.getRelmap med "-relmap"
40     Right $ C.relmapCopy med n rmap
41
42
43-- ----------------------  for
44
45-- | __for \/P R__
46-- 
47--  Map nested relation at \/P by relmap R.
48--
49--  The relamp @for \/r ( cut \/c )@ removes
50--  term @\/c@ from a nested relation at the term @\/r@.
51--
52consFor :: (K.CRel c) => C.RopCons c
53consFor med =
54    do n    <- Rop.getTerm   med "-term"
55       rmap <- Rop.getRelmap med "-relmap"
56       Right $ relmapFor med n rmap
57
58-- | Create @for@ relmap.
59relmapFor :: (K.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> K.TermName -> K.Map (C.Relmap c)
60relmapFor med n rmap = relmapForInner med n (Rop.relmapUp med n K.++ rmap)
61
62relmapForInner :: (K.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> K.TermName -> K.Map (C.Relmap c)
63relmapForInner med n = C.relmapNest med . bin where
64    bin = C.relmapBinary med $ relkitFor n
65
66-- | Create @for@ relkit.
67relkitFor :: forall c. (K.CRel c) => K.TermName -> C.RelkitBinary c
68relkitFor n (C.RelkitOutput he2 kitb2) (Just he1) = Right kit3 where
69    pk    = K.termPicker [n] he1
70    cut   = K.cutTerms pk
71    he3   = K.headConsNest n he2 $ K.headMap cut he1
72    kit3  = C.relkitConflLine False he3 confl [kitb2]
73    confl bmaps cs1 =
74        do let [bmap2] = bmaps
75           bo2 <- bmap2 [cs1]
76           Right $ K.pRel (K.Rel he2 bo2) : cut cs1
77
78relkitFor _ _ _ = C.relkitUnfixed
79
80
81
82-- ----------------------  group
83
84-- | __group R -to \/N__
85--
86--  Group relation from relmap @R@ by input relation.
87--  Grouped relations are added as content of term \/N
88--  to each input tuples.
89--
90consGroup :: (Ord c, K.CRel c) => C.RopCons c
91consGroup med =
92  do rmap <- Rop.getRelmap med "-relmap"
93     n    <- Rop.getTerm   med "-to"
94     sh   <- Rop.getMaybe Rop.getTerms med "-share"
95     Right $ relmapGroup med sh n rmap
96
97-- | Create @group@ relmap.
98relmapGroup :: (Ord c, K.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> Rop.SharedTerms -> K.TermName -> K.Map (C.Relmap c)
99relmapGroup med sh = C.relmapBinary med . relkitGroup sh
100
101-- | Create @group@ relkit.
102relkitGroup :: forall c. (Ord c, K.CRel c) => Rop.SharedTerms -> K.TermName -> C.RelkitBinary c
103relkitGroup sh n (C.RelkitOutput he2 kitb2) (Just he1) = kit3 where
104    pk      = K.termPicker he1 he2
105    pick1   = K.pkLShare pk
106    assoc2  = K.pkRAssoc pk
107
108    he3     = K.headConsNest n he2 he1
109    kit3    = case Rop.unmatchShare sh pk of
110                Nothing     -> Right $ C.relkitConflWhole False he3 f [kitb2]
111                Just (e, a) -> Msg.unmatchShare e a
112
113    f bmaps bo1 =
114        do let [bmap2] = bmaps
115           bo2 <- bmap2 bo1
116           let map2 = K.gatherToMap (assoc2 <$> bo2)
117           Right $ map (add map2) bo1
118
119    add map2 cs1 =
120        let b2maybe = pick1 cs1 `K.lookupMap` map2
121            b2sub   = K.fromMaybe [] b2maybe
122        in K.pRel (K.Rel he2 b2sub) : cs1
123
124relkitGroup _ _ _ _ = C.relkitUnfixed
125
126
127
128-- ----------------------  slice
129
130-- | __slice \/N [R]__
131--
132--  Slice input relation.
133--  Each slices have single tuple of input relation,
134--  and added as content of term \/N to each input tuples.
135--  If R is given, slices are mapped by R.
136--  If input relation has a nested relation at term \/P,
137--  the relation can be referenced by ^\/P in R.
138--
139consSlice :: (K.CRel c) => C.RopCons c
140consSlice med =
141  do n    <- Rop.getTerm   med "-term"
142     rmap <- Rop.getOptRelmap C.relmapId med "-relmap"
143     Right $ relmapSlice med n rmap
144
145-- | Create @slice@ relmap.
146relmapSlice :: (K.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> K.TermName -> K.Map (C.Relmap c)
147relmapSlice med n = C.relmapNest med . bin where
148    bin = C.relmapBinary med $ relkitSlice n
149
150-- | Create @slice@ relkit.
151relkitSlice :: (K.CRel c) => K.TermName -> C.RelkitBinary c
152relkitSlice n (C.RelkitOutput he2 kitb2) (Just he1) = Right kit3 where
153    he3   = K.headConsNest n he2 he1
154    kit3  = C.relkitConflLine False he3 confl [kitb2]
155    confl bmaps cs1 =
156        do let [bmap2] = bmaps
157           bo2 <- bmap2 [cs1]
158           Right $ K.pRel (K.Rel he2 bo2) : cs1
159relkitSlice _ _ _ = C.relkitUnfixed
160
161
162-- ----------------------  slice-up
163
164-- | __slice-up R__
165consSliceUp :: (K.CRel c) => C.RopCons c
166consSliceUp med =
167  do rmap <- Rop.getOptRelmap C.relmapId med "-relmap"
168     Right $ relmapSliceUp med rmap
169
170-- | Create @slice-up@ relmap.
171relmapSliceUp :: (K.CRel c) => C.Intmed c -> K.Map (C.Relmap c)
172relmapSliceUp med = C.relmapNest med . bin where
173    bin = C.relmapBinary med relkitSliceUp
174
175-- | Create @slice-up@ relkit.
176relkitSliceUp :: (K.CRel c) => C.RelkitBinary c
177relkitSliceUp (C.RelkitOutput he2 kitb2) _ = Right kit3 where
178    kit3  = C.relkitConflMany False he2 confl [kitb2]
179    confl bmaps cs1 = do let [bmap2] = bmaps
180                         bmap2 [cs1]
181relkitSliceUp _ _ = C.relkitUnfixed
182
